poll_list.title: Inclusion Poll for Calendar Exceptions (MIP4c2-SP6)- November 9, 2020

content.content: MIP4c2-SP6: Calendar Exceptions Preamble MIP4c2-SP#: 6 MIP to be amended: MIP3 Author(s): @LongForWisdom Contributors: Status: Formal Submission (FS) Date of Amendment Submission: 2020-10-05 Date of ratification: <yyyy-mm-dd>  Specification Motivation Although Maker is intended to be a global protocol, in its current state the majority of the active members of governance are located in the United States or Europe. Both these regions have winter holidays that would clash with the conclusion of a monthly governance cycle in December. It is hoped that this exception can be removed in the future when governance of the protocol is more globally distributed. This change is an addition and makes no modification to the current contents of MIP3 beyond preventing a monthly governance cycle in December, due to this, I feel that it is valid for an amendment and not a replacement of MIP3. This change has no impact on other MIPs that interact with MIP3, with the exception of preventing new MIPs or subproposals from moving into Formal Submission in December. Amended Components  MIP3c4 has been added to MIP3. There are no other changes. MIP3c4 states that there will be no monthly governance cycle in the month of December.  Amendment Pull Request (PR)   github.com/makerdao/mips         Mip3 holiday exceptions.   makerdao:RFC ← LongForWisdom:MIP3Holidays            opened 01:42PM - 05 Oct 20 UTC               LongForWisdom             +42 -0           Relevant Information No further information provided.
content.GPT-summary: The post is a formal submission of an amendment to MIP3, which proposes the addition of MIP3c4 to prevent a monthly governance cycle in December due to winter holidays in the US and Europe. The author explains the motivation behind the proposal and states that it has no impact on other MIPs. No further information is provided, but the post includes a link to the amendment pull request on GitHub. A 3rd party could give constructive criticism or audit/review the proposal.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: I’m not understanding the implication of this change. Will there just be no governance decisions in the month of December (outside of the weekly cycle)? If so, would it make more sense to expedite the cycle so that it does not clash with holidays?
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: Kudos! Bankers are renown for diligent holiday observance.

I’d rather skip the cycle rather than try to compress it. There is a reason it’s one month long. We could potentially move it forward a week and start it on November 30th which would have the monthly executive go up on December 21st. I’m still leaning towards just skipping it though, people have been working hard, most MKR Holders aren’t paid. Anything critical that comes up can happen using the weekly cycle as you’ve described. Collateral onboarding probably isn’t going to be using the monthly cycle anyway.
GPT-discussion-categories: None of the topics listed match

content.content: Curious. What aspects of governance would be suspended? All rate changes? Debt Ceilings of existing collateral? Weekly Governance Cycles? or just new governance submissions? To an extent I get the lens in which this was proposed, but not having weekly governance during 8% of the year seems a bit “off” and almost dangerous. Further (and specific to MIP21 and its sub-proposal), significant capital is being spent to build the structures contemplated in that MIP. Hearing that we would not be able to put forth a governance request for implementing a debt ceiling is disappointing and frustrating to say the least. As such, I would propose a compromise. I advocate for a hybrid where no new collateral would be added in that month rather just the weekly cycle to on-board that which the community has already approved. Same would also apply to interest rates and any urgent governance needs. I may easily be misunderstanding the implications of your proposal as it may be a complete non-issue. Please let me know if I am missing it.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: LongForWisdom:  This change is an addition and makes no modification to the current contents of MIP3 beyond preventing a monthly governance cycle in December   The only change is to not have the monthly governance cycle in December. The weekly cycle is not affected by this MIP, however I will most likely just say there will be no weekly cycle on the weeks beginning the 21st and the 28th as governance facilitator. These weeks cover Christmas and New Year. I don’t expect this to meaningfully affect your plans with MIP21, as long as you don’t try to implement those plans using the weekly cycle during the weeks of the 21st and the 28th.     mrabino1:  I may easily be misunderstanding the implications of your proposal as it may be a complete non-issue.   Yep the key misunderstanding is that it would only be the monthly cycle that is cancelled for December via this MIP (so no new MIPs or subproposals in December.) As mentioned, I will likely cancel the weekly cycle (including the weekly governance and risk meetings) in the last two weeks of December, but I don’t believe I need to pass a MIP to do that.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal
